result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deshron Earl Perkins-Hammond

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deshron Earl Perkins-Hammond in court.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Deshron Earl Perkins-Hammond.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. for Amy Spanczak in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final Pre-Trial. Defense has filed motion to adjourn the Jury Trial.  State does not object. Motion GRANTED.  Jury trial set for 10/10/2022 is VACATED.  Court sets new dates for Jury trial and final pretrial. Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am. Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Defense Request for Adjournment of Trial, filed.
Notice of Intent to Use DNA evidence at Trial, filed.

Defendant Deshron Earl Perkins-Hammond in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  State has yet to submit case for DNA/Drug analysis.  Court orders all crime lab reports turned over to defense no later than 8/10/2022.  Any defense motions based on crime lab reports are due no later than 9/7/2022.  If defense files any motions, they are to contact to Court to schedule a motion hearing date.  All plea documents are due 9/23/2022; trial documents are due 9/30/2022.  Case adjourned, Br. 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Deshron Earl Perkins-Hammond in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Amy E Spanczak appeared on behalf of Anthony Moore for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Discussions with parties put forth on the record. Court sets deadline of 03/25/2022 for the exchange of discovery with the exception of crime lab reports. In addition, Court sets 04/22/2022 deadline for filing any motions, and 05/02/2022 deadline for filing change of plea forms. Case adjourned to Br 17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Deshron Earl Perkins-Hammond in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Deshron Earl Perkins-Hammond in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Trooper Alex Medina - Wisconsin State Patrol. Court took judicial notice of defendant's prior conviction regarding case#19CF3010.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Deshron Earl Perkins-Hammond in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Deshron Earl Perkins-Hammond in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deshron Earl Perkins-Hammond appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
